column9: str

ALIASES:
　/say, /s
USAGE:
　/say [message]

→Sends a message to all PCs within a small radius. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Say] in the chat filter. Typing /say or /s without a message switches the default chat mode to [Say].

ALIASES:
　/shout, /sh
USAGE:
　/shout [message]

→Sends a message to all PCs in the same area. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Shout] in the chat filter.

ALIASES:
　/tell, /t
USAGE:
　/tell [PC name] [message]

→Sends a message to a specific PC within the same World. This message cannot be seen by other PCs, and will not be displayed if [Tell] is deselected in the chat filter. Typing /tell or /t [PC name] without a message switches the default chat mode to [Tell].

ALIASES:
　/party, /p
USAGE:
　/party [message]

→Sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Party] in the chat filter. Typing /party or /p without a message switches the default chat mode to [Party].

ALIASES:
　/linkshell, /l
USAGE:
　/linkshell [message]

→Sends a message to all members of your active linkshell, regardless of their location. Typing /linkshell or /l without a message switches the default chat mode to [Linkshell].

ALIASES:
　/linkshell1, /l1
USAGE:
　/linkshell1 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 1, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell2, /l2
USAGE:
　/linkshell2 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 2, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell3, /l3
USAGE:
　/linkshell3 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 3, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell4, /l4
USAGE:
　/linkshell4 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 4, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell5, /l5
USAGE:
　/linkshell5 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 5, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell6, /l6
USAGE:
　/linkshell6 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 6, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell7, /l7
USAGE:
　/linkshell7 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 7, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/linkshell8, /l8
USAGE:
　/linkshell8 [message]

→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 8, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:
　/freecompany, /fc
USAGE:
　/freecompany [message]

→Sends a message to all members of your free company, regardless of their location. Typing /freecompany or /fc without a message switches the default chat mode to [Free Company].

ALIASES:
　/echo, /e
USAGE:
　/echo [message]

→Displays a message that only you can see.

ALIASES:
　/yell, /y
USAGE:
　/yell [message]

→Sends a message to all PCs within a large radius. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Yell] in the chat filter. Typing /yell or /y without a message switches the default chat mode to [Yell].

ALIASES:
　/reply, /r
USAGE:
　/r [message]

→Sends a message to the last player from whom you received a /tell.

ALIASES:
　/alliance, /a
USAGE:
　/alliance [message]

→Sends a message to all members of your current alliance, regardless of their location. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Alliance] in the chat filter. Typing /alliance or /a without a message switches the default chat mode to [Alliance].

USAGE:
　/join

→Accepts a party invite.

USAGE:
　/decline

→Declines a party invite.

USAGE:
　/invite “PC name”

→Invites the specified PC to your party. Invites current target when no name is specified.

USAGE:
　/kick “PC name”

→Kicks the specified PC from your party. Kicks current target when no name is specified.

USAGE:
　/leader “PC name”

→Promotes the specified PC to party leader. Promotes current target when no name is specified.

USAGE:
　/leave

→Leave your current party.

ALIASES:
　/check, /c
USAGE:
　/check “PC name”

→Examines the specified PC. Examines current target when no name is specified.

USAGE:
　/trade

→Initiates a trade with your current target.

USAGE:
　/automove [subcommand]

→Begin moving in the current direction you are facing.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>    Initiate automove.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>    Cancel automove.

Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:
　/follow

→Automatically follow a targeted PC.

USAGE:
　/loot

→Opens the nearest treasure coffer and displays the loot list.

USAGE:
　/meldrequest “PC name”

→Sends a materia meld request to the specified PC. Sends request to current target when no name is specified.

ALIASES:
　/character, /gear
USAGE:
　/character

→Opens and closes the Character interface.

USAGE:
　/journal

→Opens and closes the quest journal.

ALIASES:
　/dutyfinder, /finder
USAGE:
　/dutyfinder

→Opens and closes the Duty Finder.

ALIASES:
　/armourychest, /armoury
USAGE: 
　/armourychest

→Opens and closes your Armoury Chest.

ALIASES:
　/huntinglog, /hlog
USAGE:
　/huntinglog

→Opens and closes the hunting log.

ALIASES:
　/craftinglog, /clog
USAGE:
　/craftinglog

→Opens and closes the crafting log.

ALIASES:
　/gatheringlog, /glog
USAGE:
　/gatheringlog

→Opens and closes the gathering log.

ALIASES:
　/fishinglog, /flog
USAGE:
　/fishinglog

→Opens and closes the fishing log.

USAGE:
　/achievements

→Opens the list of in-game FINAL FANTASY XIV achievements.

ALIASES:
　/partycmd, /pcmd
USAGE:
　/partycmd [subcommand]

→Executes various party commands.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>join</Color>
　　Accept a party invite.
　<Color(-154)>decline</Color>
　　Decline a party invite.
　<Color(-154)>add “PC name”</Color>
　　Invite a PC to your party.
　<Color(-154)>leave</Color>
　　Leave your current party.
　<Color(-154)>kick “PC name”</Color>
　　Oust a PC from your party.
　<Color(-154)>breakup </Color>
　　Dissolve your current party.

Opens and closes the Party menu when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/friendlist, /flist
USAGE:
　/friendlist [subcommand]

→Executes various friend list commands.

>>Subcommands:
  <Color(-154)>add “PC name”</Color>
　　Send a PC a friend request.
  <Color(-154)>accept “PC name”</Color>
　　Accept a friend request from
　　a PC.
  <Color(-154)>deny “PC name”</Color>
　　Deny a friend request from a
　　PC.
  <Color(-154)>remove “PC name”</Color>
　　Remove a PC from your
　　friend list.

Opens and closes friend list when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/blacklist, /blist
USAGE:
　/blacklist [subcommand]

→Executes various blacklist commands.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>add “PC name”</Color>
　　Add a PC to your blacklist.
　<Color(-154)>remove “PC name” </Color>
　　Remove a PC from your
　　blacklist.

Opens and closes blacklist when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/search, /sea
USAGE:
　/search [condition]

→Executes a player search based on the conditions given. Multiple conditions should be separated with a space. Conducts default search if no conditions are specified.

>>Conditions:
【PC Name】
　<Color(-154)>forename “PC name”</Color>
　　Search for a specific first
　　name.
　<Color(-154)>surname “PC name”</Color>
　　Search for a specific last
　　name.
【Online Status】
　<Color(-154)>leader</Color>, <Color(-154)>away</Color>, <Color(-154)>busy</Color>, <Color(-154)>duty</Color>
　<Color(-154)>event</Color>, <Color(-154)>lookingforparty</Color>
　<Color(-154)>lookingtomeld</Color>
【Class & Job】
　<Color(-154)>GLA</Color>, <Color(-154)>PGL</Color>, <Color(-154)>MRD</Color>, <Color(-154)>LNC</Color>, <Color(-154)>ARC</Color>, <Color(-154)>ROG</Color>
　<Color(-154)>CNJ</Color>, <Color(-154)>THM</Color>, <Color(-154)>ACN</Color>, <Color(-154)>CRP</Color>, <Color(-154)>BSM</Color>, <Color(-154)>ARM</Color>
　<Color(-154)>GSM</Color>, <Color(-154)>LTW</Color>, <Color(-154)>WVR</Color>, <Color(-154)>ALC</Color>, <Color(-154)>CUL</Color>, <Color(-154)>MIN</Color>
　<Color(-154)>BTN</Color>, <Color(-154)>FSH</Color>, <Color(-154)>PLD</Color>, <Color(-154)>MNK</Color>, <Color(-154)>WAR</Color>, <Color(-154)>DRG</Color>
　<Color(-154)>BRD</Color>, <Color(-154)>WHM</Color>, <Color(-154)>BLM</Color>, <Color(-154)>SMN</Color>, <Color(-154)>SCH</Color>
　<Color(-154)>NIN</Color>
Searches all jobs and classes if none specified.
【Level】
　<Color(-154)>[number]</Color>
　　Search for that level only.
　<Color(-154)>[number 1]-[number 2]</Color>
　　Search for players with
　　levels between number 1
　　and number 2.
Searches all levels if none are specified.
【Grand Company】
　<Color(-154)>“Maelstrom”</Color>
　<Color(-154)>“Immortal Flames”</Color>
　<Color(-154)>“Order of the Twin Adder”</Color>
【Location】
　<Color(-154)>“Limsa Lominsa”</Color>, <Color(-154)>“Gridania”</Color>
　<Color(-154)>“Ul'dah”</Color>, <Color(-154)>“The Black Shroud”</Color>
　<Color(-154)>“La Noscea”</Color>, <Color(-154)>“Thanalan”</Color>
　<Color(-154)>“Coerthas”</Color>, <Color(-154)>“Mor Dhona”</Color>
Searches all locations if none are specified.
【Language】
　<Color(-154)>JA</Color>, <Color(-154)>EN</Color>, <Color(-154)>FR</Color>, <Color(-154)>DE</Color>
Searches current language if none is specified.

>>Example:
　/sea GLA 20-30 “La Noscea”
　(Searches for all gladiators in
　La Noscea between levels 20
　and 30.)

USAGE:
　/map

→Opens and closes the current area map.

USAGE:
　/teleport

→Opens the Teleport interface.

ALIASES:
　/enemysign, /marking, /mk
USAGE:
　/enemysign [sign type] “target”

→Set a sign on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified.

>>Sign types:
  <Color(-154)>attack1-5</Color>
  <Color(-154)>bind1-3</Color>
  <Color(-154)>ignore1-2</Color>
  <Color(-154)>circle</Color>
  <Color(-154)>cross</Color>
  <Color(-154)>square</Color>
  <Color(-154)>triangle</Color>
  <Color(-154)>off </Color>      Turns off sign.

Opens and closes the Signs menu when no subcommand is specified.

>>Example:
　/marking attack2 <t>
　(Assigns “Target to Attack 2”
　to target.)

ALIASES:

USAGE:

→Opens and closes the Actions & Traits interface.

→Opens and closes the Timers interface.

→Opens and closes the Recommendations list.

→Opens and closes the list of available emotes.

→Opens and closes the Keybind interface.

→Opens and closes the user macro editor.

USAGE:

ALIASES:
　/partysort, /psort
USAGE:
　/partysort
→Sort the party list in the specified order.

ALIASES:

USAGE:
　/readycheck

→Initiate ready check.

ALIASES:
　/ready, /rd
USAGE:
　/ready

→Indicate that you are ready when a ready check has been initiated.

→Indicate that you are not ready when a ready check has been initiated.

ALIASES:
　/waymark, /wmark
USAGE:
　/wmark [marker] “target”

→Place a waymark on the ground below a target. If no target is specified, a waymark will be placed beneath your cursor.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>a </Color> Place or remove waymark A.
　<Color(-154)>b </Color> Place or remove waymark B.
　<Color(-154)>c </Color> Place or remove waymark C.
　<Color(-154)>clear </Color> Remove all waymarks.

Places an unused waymark in the order of A-C when no subcommand is specified. More than three waymarks cannot be placed at one time. If a target name is specified, a marker name must also be specified.

ALIASES:
　/fishguide, /fg
USAGE:
　/fishguide

→Opens and closes the Fish Guide interface.

USAGE:

→Opens and closes the Housing interface.

USAGE:
　/minionguide

→Opens and closes the Minion Guide interface.

USAGE:
　/mountguide

→Opens and closes the Mount Guide interface.

　/partyfinder, /pfinder
USAGE:
　/partyfinder

→Opens and closes the Party Finder interface.

ALIASES:
　/pvpprofile, /pvpp
USAGE:
　/pvpprofile

→Opens and closes the PvP Profile interface.

ALIASES:
　/companion, /comp
USAGE:
　/companion

→Opens and closes the Companion interface.

ALIASES:
　/keyitem, /kitem
USAGE:
　/keyitem

→Opens and closes the Key Item interface.

USAGE:

→Opens and closes the Challenge Log interface.

→Opens and closes the Sightseeing Log interface.

USAGE:
　/goldsaucer

→Opens and closes the Gold Saucer interface.

USAGE:
　/? [text command]

→Gives a detailed explanation of the specified text command.

USAGE:
　/wait [wait time]

→A macro command for adjusting the pause between commands. A wait time amount of 1 equals one second. The maximum wait time allowed is 60. If the wait time amount is over 60, it will be counted as 60.

ALIASES:
　/legacymark, /lmark
USAGE:
　/legacymark [subcommand]

→Show or hide the Mark of the Twelve─a brand appearing on the back of the neck of all who survived the Calamity.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>      Show mark.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>     Hide mark.

Toggle between shown and hidden when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:
　/gcsalute [subcommand]

→Perform the official salute of the Grand Company to which you belong.

>>Subcommands:
 　<Color(-154)>motion</Color>  Perform motion only.

Both text and motion will be displayed when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/macroicon, /micon
USAGE:
　/micon “icon name” [category]

→Displays the specified icon as a hotbar icon. If used twice in a single user macro, only the first instance will be recognized.

>>Categories:
　<Color(-154)>action</Color>
　　If the icon name is an
　　action, action recast time
　　and required MP/TP will
　　be displayed with the icon.
　<Color(-154)>general</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　general action, action
　　recast time will be
　　displayed with the icon.
　<Color(-154)>emote</Color>
　　If the icon name is an
　　emote, its icon will be
　　displayed.
　<Color(-154)>companion</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　companion action, action
　　recast time and required
　　MP/TP will be displayed
　　with the icon.
　<Color(-154)>pet</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　pet action, action recast
　　time and required MP/TP
　　will be displayed with the
　　icon.
　<Color(-154)>minion</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　minion, its icon will be
　　displayed.
　<Color(-154)>mount</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　mount, its icon will be
　　displayed.
　<Color(-154)>enemysign</Color>
　　If the icon name is an
　　enemy sign, its icon will
　　be displayed.
　<Color(-154)>waymark</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　waymark, its icon will
　　be displayed.
　<Color(-154)>gearset</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　gear set number, its
　　icon will be displayed.
　<Color(-154)>classjob</Color>
　　If the icon name is a
　　class or job, its icon
　　will be displayed.

Category defaults to action when none is specified.

USAGE:
　/recast “action name”

→Displays time remaining until the specified action can be used again.

ALIASES:
　/gearset, /gs
USAGE:
　/gearset [subcommand]

→Execute gear set functions.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>change [number] </Color>
　　Equip gear in slot [number].
　<Color(-154)>view [number] </Color>
　　List gear in slot [number].
　<Color(-154)>save [number] </Color>
　　Save current gear to slot
　　[number].
　<Color(-154)>delete [number] </Color>
　　Delete slot [number].

ALIASES:
　　/itemsort, /isort
USAGE:
　　/itemsort [subcommand]

→Sorts your inventory based on the conditions given. This command does not effect the Sort function.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>condition [Category]
　[Condition] [Order]</Color>
　　Sets the items to be sorted
　　along with sorting order.
　<Color(-154)>execute [Category]</Color>
　　Sorts the specified items
　　based on the conditions
　　given.
　<Color(-154)>clear [Category]</Color>
　　Clears sort conditions for the
　　specified item category.

>>Categories:
　<Color(-154)>inventory</Color>, <Color(-154)>retainer</Color>, <Color(-154)>armoury</Color>
　<Color(-154)>mh</Color>, <Color(-154)>oh</Color>, <Color(-154)>head</Color>, <Color(-154)>body</Color>, <Color(-154)>hands</Color>
　<Color(-154)>waist</Color>, <Color(-154)>legs</Color>, <Color(-154)>feet</Color>, <Color(-154)>neck</Color>, <Color(-154)>ears</Color>
　<Color(-154)>wrists</Color>, <Color(-154)>rings</Color>, <Color(-154)>soul</Color>

>>Conditions:
　<Color(-154)>id</Color>, <Color(-154)>spiritbond</Color>, <Color(-154)>category</Color>, <Color(-154)>lv</Color>, <Color(-154)>ilv</Color>
　<Color(-154)>stack</Color>, <Color(-154)>hq</Color>, <Color(-154)>materia</Color>, <Color(-154)>pdamage</Color>
　<Color(-154)>mdamage</Color>, <Color(-154)>delay</Color>, <Color(-154)>autoattack</Color>
　<Color(-154)>blockrate</Color>, <Color(-154)>blockstrength</Color>
　<Color(-154)>defense</Color>, <Color(-154)>mdefense</Color>
　<Color(-154)>str</Color>, <Color(-154)>dex</Color>, <Color(-154)>vit</Color>, <Color(-154)>int</Color>, <Color(-154)>mnd</Color>, <Color(-154)>pie</Color>
　<Color(-154)>craftsmanship</Color>, <Color(-154)>control</Color>
　<Color(-154)>gathering</Color>, <Color(-154)>perception</Color>, <Color(-154)>tab</Color>

>>Order:
　<Color(-154)>asc</Color>, <Color(-154)>des</Color>

 Defaults to ascending if order is not specified. Cannot be used if one of the conditions is “tab”.

>>Example:
　/isort condition mh lv asc
　(Sets main arms to be sorted
　by ascending equipping level.)

　/itemsort condition mh ilv des
　(Sets main arms to be sorted
　by descending item level.)

　/itemsort execute mh
　(Sorts main arms based on
　the above conditions.)

USAGE:
　/random

→Displays within a /say radius a random number between 0 and 999.

USAGE:
　/instance

　　　　→Displays whether or not your character is currently in an instanced area.

ALIASES:
　/cleartellhistory, /cth
USAGE:
　/cleartellhistory

→Deletes all record of previous /tell messages.

ALIASES:
　/macrolock, /mlock
USAGE:
　/macrolock

→Prevents the execution of any additional macros until all steps following /macrolock have been executed.

ALIASES:
　/macroerror, /merror
USAGE:
　/macroerror [subcommand]

→Display or hide text command errors within a user macro. Any errors are displayed upon macro execution. Setting resets to <Color(-154)>1</Color> after macro is executed.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>   Displays error message.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>   Hides error message.

Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/clearlog, /cl
USAGE:
　/clearlog

→Delete all past messages from your entire chat log.

ALIASES:
　/macrocancel, /mcancel
USAGE:
　/macrocancel

→Cancel the currently executed macro. Cannot be used in a macro.

USAGE:
　/busy [subcommand]

→Set your online status to Busy/Online.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>    Set your status to Busy.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>    Set your status to Online.

Toggle between Busy and Online when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/away, /afk
USAGE:
　/away [subcommand]

→Set your online status to Away/Online.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>     Set your status to Away.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>     Set your status to Online.

Toggle between Away and Online when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/lookingforparty, /lfp
USAGE:
　/lfp [subcommand] [class]

→Set your online status to Looking for Party/Online.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>
　　Set your status to Looking for
　　Party.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>
　　Set your status to Online.

Toggle between Looking for Party and Online when no subcommand is specified.

>>Classes/Jobs:
　<Color(-154)>GLA</Color>, <Color(-154)>PGL</Color>, <Color(-154)>MRD</Color>, <Color(-154)>LNC</Color>, <Color(-154)>ARC</Color>, <Color(-154)>ROG</Color>
　<Color(-154)>CNJ</Color>, <Color(-154)>THM</Color>, <Color(-154)>ACN</Color>, <Color(-154)>CRP</Color>, <Color(-154)>BSM</Color>, <Color(-154)>ARM</Color>
　<Color(-154)>GSM</Color>, <Color(-154)>LTW</Color>, <Color(-154)>WVR</Color>, <Color(-154)>ALC</Color>, <Color(-154)>CUL</Color>, <Color(-154)>MIN</Color>
　<Color(-154)>BTN</Color>, <Color(-154)>FSH</Color>, <Color(-154)>PLD</Color>, <Color(-154)>MNK</Color>, <Color(-154)>WAR</Color>, <Color(-154)>DRG</Color>
　<Color(-154)>BRD</Color>, <Color(-154)>WHM</Color>, <Color(-154)>BLM</Color>, <Color(-154)>SMN</Color>, <Color(-154)>SCH</Color>
　<Color(-154)>NIN</Color>

Multiple classes/jobs─or none at all─may be specified.

ALIASES:
　/lookingtomeld, /ltm
USAGE:
　/lookingtomeld [subcommand]

→Set your online status to Looking to Meld Materia/Online.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>
　　Set your status to Looking to
　　Meld Materia.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>
　　Set your status to Online.

Toggle between Looking to Meld Materia and Online when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/searchcomment, /scomment
USAGE:
　/searchcomment [comment]

→Change your search comment.

ALIASES:
　/action, /ac
USAGE:
　/action “action name” “target”

→Uses an action on the specified PC or placeholder. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain actions. This cannot be used with actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors.

ALIASES:
　/battlemode, /bm
USAGE:
　/battlemode [subcommand]

→Toggle between active and passive mode.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>    Switch to active mode.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>    Switch to passive mode.

Toggle between active and passive mode when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:
　/target, /ta
USAGE:
　/target “PC name”

→Targets the specified PC. Target must be within a certain radius for this command to function.

ALIASES:
　/targetpc, /tpc
USAGE:
　/targetpc

→Targets the closest PC within a certain radius.

ALIASES:
　/targetnpc, /tnpc
USAGE:
　/targetnpc

→Targets the closest NPC within a certain radius.

ALIASES:
　/targetenemy, /tenemy
USAGE:
　/targetenemy

→Targets the closest enemy within a certain radius.

ALIASES:
　/battletarget, /bt
USAGE:
　/battletarget

→Targets the closest enemy within a certain radius that is attacking you.

ALIASES:
　/assist, /as
USAGE:
　/assist “PC name”

→Targets the target of another PC. Assists current target when none is specified.

ALIASES:
　/facetarget, /ft
USAGE:
　/facetarget

→Immediately turns your PC in the direction of your current target.

ALIASES:
　/nexttarget, /nt
USAGE:
　/nexttarget

→Toggle clockwise through on-screen enemies.

ALIASES:
　/previoustarget, /pt
USAGE:
　/previoustarget

→Toggle counterclockwise through on-screen enemies.

ALIASES:
　/targetlasttarget, /tlt
USAGE:
　/targetlasttarget

→Re-target your last target.

ALIASES:
　/targetlastenemy, /tle
USAGE:
　/targetlastenemy

→Re-target the last enemy you targeted.

ALIASES:
　/lockon, /lo
USAGE:
　/lockon [subcommand]

→Lock on/off current target.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>     Enable lock-on.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>    Disable lock-on.

Toggle between on/off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:
　/focustarget “PC name”

→Makes the specified PC your focus target. Makes current target your focus target when none specified.

ALIASES:
　/petaction, /pac
USAGE:
　/pac “pet action name” “target”

→Uses a pet action on the specified PC or placeholder. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain pet actions. This cannot be used with pet actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors.

ALIASES:
　/companionaction, /cac
USAGE:
　/cac “companion action name”

→Uses a companion action. The target of companion actions cannot be specified. This cannot be used with companion actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors.

ALIASES:
　/facecamera, /fcam
USAGE:
　/facecamera

→Gaze continuously at the camera. Execute command again to cancel.

ALIASES:
　/levelsync, /lsync
USAGE:
　/levelsync [subcommand]

→Sync your level when the option is available, such as during FATEs.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>     Start level sync.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>    End level sync.

Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:
　/mount “mount name”

→Summon or dismiss the specifed mount. Mount name is not necessary when dismissing.

　<Color(-154)>off </Color> Remove additonal action.

Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:
　/chatlog [subcommand]

→Configure log window settings.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>name [number 0-3]</Color>
　　Change the way names are
　　displayed in your log window.
　　　<Color(-154)>0</Color> Full Name
　　　<Color(-154)>1</Color> Last Name Initialed
　　　<Color(-154)>2</Color> First Name Initialed
　　　<Color(-154)>3</Color> Initials Only
<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(75),1))>　<Color(-154)>fontsize [number] </Color>
　　Adjust log window font size.
　<Color(-154)>time on </Color>
　　Add time stamps to all
　　messages.
　<Color(-154)>time off </Color>
　　Remove time stamps from all
　　messages.
　<Color(-154)>time </Color>
　　Toggle time stamps on/off.
<Else/>　<Color(-154)>fontsize [tab number] [number]</Color>
　　Adjust [tab number] log
　　window font size to
　　[number].
　<Color(-154)>time [tab number] on</Color>
　　Add time stamps to all
　　messages on [tab number]
　　log window.
　<Color(-154)>time [tab number] off</Color>
　　Remove time stamps from all
　　messages on [tab number]
　　log window.
　<Color(-154)>time [tab number]</Color>
　　Toggle time stamps on/off
　　for all messages on
　　[tab number] log window.
</If>　<Color(-154)>time 12 </Color>
　　Set time display to 12-hour
　　format.
　<Color(-154)>time 24 </Color>
　　Set time display to 24-hour
　　format.
　<Color(-154)>time local </Color>
　　Set time stamp clock to local
　　time.
　<Color(-154)>time server </Color>
　　Set time stamp clock to server
　　time.
　<Color(-154)>call on </Color>
　　Play sound upon receiving
　　/tell.
　<Color(-154)>call off </Color>
　　Play no sound upon receiving
　　/tell.
　<Color(-154)>call [chat channel]</Color>
　　Toggle /tell sound on/off for
　　the specified chat channel.
　　　<Color(-154)>t</Color> Tell
　　　<Color(-154)>p</Color> Party
　　　<Color(-154)>fc</Color> Free Company
　　　<Color(-154)>al</Color> Alliance
　　　<Color(-154)>l1-8</Color> Linkshell 1-8

ALIASES:

→Configure battle effects settings.

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>self </Color>
　　Configure own battle effects
　　settings.
　<Color(-154)>party </Color>
　　Configure party members'

　<Color(-154)>other </Color>
　　Configure other NPCs' battle
　　effects settings.

>>Settings:
　<Color(-154)>all </Color>           Show all effects.
　<Color(-154)>simple </Color>   Show limited effects.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>          Hide all effects.

　　<Color(-154)>ParamBar</Color>, <Color(-154)>param</Color>

　　<Color(-154)>MainMenu</Color>, <Color(-154)>mmenu</Color>

　Gil
　　<Color(-154)>Gil</Color>, <Color(-154)>gil</Color>
　Inventory Grid
　　<Color(-154)>InventoryGrid</Color>, <Color(-154)>igrid</Color>
　Duty List
　　<Color(-154)>DutyList</Color>, <Color(-154)>dlist</Color>
　Item Help
　　<Color(-154)>ItemHelp</Color>, <Color(-154)>ihelp</Color>
　Action Help
　　<Color(-154)>ActionHelp</Color>, <Color(-154)>ahelp</Color>
　LimitGauge

  Alliance List 1
    <Color(-154)>AllianceList1</Color>, <Color(-154)>alist1</Color>
  Alliance List 2
    <Color(-154)>AllianceList2</Color>, <Color(-154)>alist2</Color>

>>Subcommands:
　<Color(-154)>on </Color>        Show element.
　<Color(-154)>off </Color>        Hide element.

Toggle between on/off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:
　/hotbar [subcommand]

→Edit and configure hotbar settings.

>>Subcommands
　<Color(-154)>action “action name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. If [#2] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [#1] and [#2] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands.
　<Color(-154)>general “general action name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified general action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>item “item name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified item to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>emote “emote name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified emote to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>companion “companion action name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified companion action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>pet “action name” “pet name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified pet action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>minion “minion name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified minion to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>mount “mount name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified mount to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>enemysign “enemy sign name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified enemy sign to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].
　<Color(-154)>waymark “waymark name” [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Set the specified waymark to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<Color(-154)>change [number]</Color>
　　Replace current hotbar with hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>copy [class 1] [#1] [class 2] [#2]</Color>
　　Copy the contents of [class 1] hotbar [#1] to the [class 2] hotbar [#2].
　　The subcommand “current” can be used to specify your current class.
　　The subcommand “share” can be used instead of a class to specify your shared hotbar.
　<Color(-154)>display [number] on</Color>
　　Display hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>display [number] off</Color>
　　Hide hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>display [number]</Color>
　　Toggle on/off hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>share [number] on</Color>
　　Make hotbar [number] shared.
　<Color(-154)>share [number] off</Color>
　　Unshare hotbar [number] and assign it to your current class/job.
　<Color(-154)>share [number]</Color>
　　Toggle between on/off.
　<Color(-154)>remove [#1] [#2]</Color>
　　Remove the action assigned to slot [#2] on hotbar [#1].
　　Replace [#2] with “all” to remove all actions from hotbar [#1].

ALIASES:
　/crosshotbar, /chotbar
USAGE:
　/crosshotbar [subcommand]

→Edit and configure cross hotbar settings.

>>Subcommands
　<Color(-154)>set “action name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. If [slot name] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [number] and [slot name] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered cross hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands.
　<Color(-154)>general “general action name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified general action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>item “item name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified item to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>emote “emote name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified emote to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>companion “companion action name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified companion action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>pet “action name” “pet name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified pet action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>minion “minion name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified minion to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>mount “mount name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified mount to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>enemysign “enemy sign name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified enemy sign to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>waymark “waymark name” [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Set the specified waymark to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<Color(-154)>change [number]</Color>
　　Replace current cross hotbar with cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>copy [class 1] [number 1] [class 2] [number 2]</Color>
　　Copy the contents of [class 1] cross hotbar [number 1] to the [class 2] cross hotbar [number 2].
　　The subcommand “current” can be used to specify your current class.
　　The subcommand “share” can be used instead of a class to specify your shared hotbar.
　<Color(-154)>display [number] on</Color>
　　Display cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>display [number] off</Color>
　　Hide cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>display [number]</Color>
　　Toggle on/off cross hotbar [number].
　<Color(-154)>share [number] on</Color>
　　Make cross hotbar [number] shared.
　<Color(-154)>share [number] off</Color>
　　Unshare cross hotbar [number] and assign it to your current class/job.
　<Color(-154)>share [number]</Color>
　　Toggle between on/off.
　<Color(-154)>remove [number] [slot name]</Color>
　　Remove the action assigned to [slot name] on cross hotbar [number]. Replace [slot name] with “all” to remove all actions from cross hotbar [number].

>>Slot Names:
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(3)/>  <Color(-154)>LDL (LD1) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(3)/>  <Color(-154)>RDL (RD1)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(1)/>  <Color(-154)>LDU (LD2) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(1)/>  <Color(-154)>RDU (RD2)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(4)/>  <Color(-154)>LDR (LD3) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(4)/>  <Color(-154)>RDR (RD3)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(2)/>  <Color(-154)>LDD (LD4) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(2)/>  <Color(-154)>RDD (RD4)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(10)/>  <Color(-154)>LAL (LA1) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(10)/>  <Color(-154)>RAL (RA1)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(11)/>  <Color(-154)>LAU (LA2) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(11)/>  <Color(-154)>RAU (RA2)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(8)/>  <Color(-154)>LAR (LA3) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(8)/>  <Color(-154)>RAR (RA3)</Color>
　<Gui(14)/>＋<Gui(9)/>  <Color(-154)>LAD (LA4) </Color>
　<Gui(15)/>＋<Gui(9)/>  <Color(-154)>RAD (RA4)</Color>

USAGE:
　/hudreset

→Reverts the HUD layout to the default setting.

USAGE:
　/uireset

→Reverts the HUD layout to the default setting, and returns all closed windows to the default positions. Does not apply to open windows.

USAGE:
　/uiscale [number 60-140]

→Resize all HUD elements and windows to the percentage equivalent to the number specified. Percentages available: 60, 80, 90, 100, 110, 120, 140.

>>Subcommands:
